comments.body: I think you can delete `nname_2` here (and in the array in line 8).
That was intentional, to match the format of the existing test packages. I recognize that it's not being used now, but it's not inconceivable that we'd need tests for multiple networks.
The existing test packages always use as many names as they need (at least if I didn't forgot something myself :) ). If you don't want to remove it, fine for me as well.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +3,7 @@  set_fact:
    nname_1: "{{ name_prefix ~ '-network-1' }}"
    nname_2: "{{ name_prefix ~ '-network-2' }}"
- name: Registering network name
  set_fact:

comments.body: If there's a better way to do this, please let me know. I don't think docker includes any drivers that support multiple modes (or at least, I wasn't able to figure out how to get any of them to switch in a way that was reflected in the output - swarm and global both report as swarm for some reason, and overlay networks can't downgrade to local).
I think you should mention that as a comment in the test, so it's clear that this is not an oversight, but an conscious (unfortunate) decision you had to make.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +123,127 @@    docker_network:
      name: "{{ nname_1 }}"
      driver: overlay
      scope: swarm
    register: scope_3
